meanings.definition: a strong-smelling oil derived from a type of lemongrass, used as an insect repellent
meanings.sent1: I lit a citronella candle to keep mosquitoes away during our picnic.
meanings.sent2: The citronella spray effectively kept the bugs at bay.
meanings.sent3: The mosquitoes took one whiff of the citronella and decided to find another picnic to bother.
meanings.sent4: The citronella oil created an invisible shield against the pesky insects.
meanings.sent5: The scent of citronella lingered in the air, protecting us from mosquito bites.

meanings.definition: a plant of the geranium family with fragrant leaves that yield citronella oil
meanings.sent1: I planted citronella in my garden to naturally ward off bugs.
meanings.sent2: The citronella plant thrived in the sunny corner of the yard.
meanings.sent3: The citronella leaves danced in the breeze, releasing their bug-repelling aroma.
meanings.sent4: The citronella plant stood tall like a fragrant guardian against insects.
meanings.sent5: The essence of citronella filled the garden with a pleasant, protective fragrance.
